# Data Sets

This file collects ideas and sources of suitable data sets.

## Base R

The R datasets package contains many useful datasets: 

```{r, datasets}
library(help = "datasets")
```

`mtcars`

```{r, mtcars}
?mtcars
```

`iris`

```{r, iris}
?iris
```

`sleep`

```{r, sleep}
?sleep
# sleep

# Examples:
require(stats)
## Student's paired t-test
with(sleep,
     t.test(extra[group == 1],
            extra[group == 2], paired = TRUE))

## The sleep *prolongations*
sleep1 <- with(sleep, extra[group == 2] - extra[group == 1])
summary(sleep1)

stripchart(sleep1, method = "stack", xlab = "hours",
           main = "Sleep prolongation (n = 10)")

boxplot(sleep1, horizontal = TRUE, add = TRUE,
        at = .6, pars = list(boxwex = 0.5, staplewex = 0.25))


```

`women`

```{r, women, eval = FALSE}
?women

as_tibble(women)

# Examples:
require(graphics)
plot(women, xlab = "Height (in)", ylab = "Weight (lb)",
     main = "women data: American women aged 30-39")
```

`USArrests`

This data set contains statistics, in arrests per 100,000 residents for assault, murder, and rape in each of the 50 US states in 1973. Also given is the percent of the population living in urban areas.

```{r, USArrests, eval = FALSE}
# ?USArrests
```

## From `tidyverse` packages

```{r, tidyverse}
## Install tidyverse packages: 
# install.packages("tidyverse")
library(tidyverse)

?diamonds # Prices of 50,000 round cut diamonds

## This includes the following datasets (as tibbles):
ggplot2::diamonds
# dplyr::band_members
dplyr::starwars
tidyr::table1 # etc. 

?economics # This dataset was produced from US economic time series data available from http://research.stlouisfed.org/fred2. economics is in "wide" format, economics_long is in "long" format.
```

## `yarrr` package 

```{r yarrr_data, eval = FALSE}
library(yarrr)
library(tibble)

?pirates  
dim(pirates)  # => 1000 x 17
as_tibble(pirates)

# See also
?pirateserrors # identical, but with many errors

# Related data sets (with pirate theme): 
?auction
as_tibble(auction)

?capture
?poopdeck

# Other data sets: 
?movies
dim(movies)  # => 5000 x 13
as_tibble(movies)
```


## `MASS` package

```{r, MASS}
# install.packages("MASS")
library(MASS)

?survey # This data frame contains the responses of 237 Statistics I students 
        # at the University of Adelaide to a number of questions.

?Boston # Housing Values in Suburbs of Boston
```

## `ISLR` package

An Introduction to Statistical Learning with Applications in R  
Authors: Gareth James, Daniela Witten, Trevor Hastie and Robert Tibshirani

- R package [ISLR](https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=ISLR) (with data sets):   
- Book [PDF](http://www-bcf.usc.edu/~gareth/ISL/ISLR%20Seventh%20Printing.pdf) 
- Website: <www.StatLearning.com> or <http://www-bcf.usc.edu/~gareth/ISL/> 


## The `eurostat` package

Access to some real-world data:

- http://ropengov.github.io/eurostat/ 
- R tools to access the eurostat database, by [rOpenGov](http://ropengov.github.io/).
- Cheatsheet at <https://github.com/rstudio/cheatsheets/raw/master/eurostat.pdf>


## `dslabs` package

Datasets and functions that facilitate data analysis labs in data science courses and workshops. 

- See [this blog post](https://simplystatistics.org/2018/01/22/the-dslabs-package-provides-datasets-for-teaching-data-science/) at [simplyStats](simplystatistics.org) for an overview 
- https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=dslabs
